page.title: 10THE VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The village hall is called the{Victory {Hall,}because it was built soon after the end of the 2nd World War,replacing a wooden building. The money to build it was raised by {local efforts}and a grant from the{ {Carnegie Trust.} The main{central hall has a stage,}and the auditorium is just big enough for a badminton court. There is a{foyer, {two cloakrooms, a kitchen, and storage below the stage and above the foyer. {Two extensions}have been added, the full length of the hall on each side. The hall is used by more than 20 {village organisations,}and also for {private functions.} It provides a {surgery}for a visiting doctor. It is run by a{committee}of local people, and meets its running costs from booking fees. The committee does fund-raising for decoration, etc.
